intro: Fagonia socotrana var. luntii, commonly known as Socotra's fagonia, is a unique plant endemic to the Socotra Archipelago. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, lobed leaves and yellow flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. It is often found growing on rocky slopes and in coastal areas, showcasing its resilience. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study.
